ABSTRACT
The control used for the tapchanger of an LTC transformer or
step-voltage regulator is a prime illustration of electronic tech-
nology advances applied to the power industry. Electro-mechanical
(balance-beam and induction disc), discrete static, integrated circuit
static and now digital designs have evolved over the past forty
years. This increased product sophistication has made possible
many features beyond the primary objective of simple raise-lower
commands in response to the measured secondary voltage.
